CVE-2013-0127.title: IBM Lotus Notes Java applet tag cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0127.body: IBM Lotus Notes is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input related to Java applet and JavaScript tags inside HTML emails. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0168.title: Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager MoveDisk command denial of service
CVE-2013-0168.body: Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper permission checking in the MoveDisk command. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to consume all available free space.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2013-0170.title: libvirt virNetMessageFree() code execution
CVE-2013-0170.body: libvirt could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an use-after-free error in the virNetMessageFree() function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system with root privileges.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the libvirt GIT Repository. See References.

CVE-2013-0176.title: libssh publickey_from_privatekey() function denial of service
CVE-2013-0176.body: libssh is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a NULL pointer dereference error when processing "Client: Diffie-Hellman Key Exchange Init" packet. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of libssh (0.5.4 or later), available from the libssh Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-0178.title: Redis swap file symlink
CVE-2013-0178.body: Redis could allow a local attacker to launch a symlink attack. The server.vm_swap_file creates temporary files insecurely. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a symbolic link from a temporary file to various files on the system, which could allow the attacker to overwrite arbitrary files on the system with elevated privileges.Upgrade to the latest version of Redis (2.6.8 or later), available from the Redis Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-0181.title: Search API module for Drupal unspecified cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0181.body: Search API module for Drupal is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input when displaying errors in the database backend view. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to SA-CONTRIB-2013-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0201.title: ownCloud mime and token parameters cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0201.body: ownCloud is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the resetpassword.php, mimeicon.php and sharing.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the mime and token parameters in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to oC-SA-2013-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0202.title: ownCloud sharing.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0202.body: ownCloud is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the sharing.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the action parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to oC-SA-2013-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0203.title: ownCloud new.php and addBookmark.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0203.body: ownCloud is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the new.php and addBookmark.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the url field to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to oC-SA-2013-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0208.title: OpenStack Compute (Nova) volume security bypass
CVE-2013-0208.body: OpenStack Compute (Nova) could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the improper verification of the volume ID when using the Boot From Volume mechanism. If the Cinder mechanism is not used, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to boot from arbitrary volumes.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the OpenStack GIT Repository. See References.

CVE-2013-0218.title: Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform information disclosure
CVE-2013-0218.body: Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform and Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Web Platform could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the creation of a world-readable auto-install XML file by the GUI installer. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain unauthorized administrative access to the password and other sensitive information.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2013-0231.title: Xen pciback_enable_msi() denial of service
CVE-2013-0231.body: Xen is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the failure to limit the rate of kernel log messages by the pciback_enable_msi() function. By flooding the system with kernel messages, a local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to render the system unusable.Refer to XSA-43 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-0238.title: IRCD-Hybrid try_parse_v4_netmask() denial of service
CVE-2013-0238.body: IRCD-Hybrid is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the try_parse_v4_netmask() function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using IPv4 masks to cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of IRCD-Hybrid (8.0.6 or later), available from the IRCD-Hybrid Web Page. See References.

CVE-2013-0239.title: Apache CXF UsernameTokens security bypass
CVE-2013-0239.body: Apache CXF could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the improper handling of WS-SecurityPolicy enabled plaintext UsernameTokens. By sending a specially-crafted SOAP request containing a WS-Security UsernameToken in the security header, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass the authentication process and gain unauthorized access to the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Apache CXF (2.5.9, 2.6.6, or 2.7.3 or later), available from the Apache CXF Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-0245.title: Book module printer friendly version for Drupal title security bypass
CVE-2013-0245.body: Book module printer friendly version for Drupal could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By sending a specially-crafted request, a remote attacker having 'access printer-friendly version' permission could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions to view title and content of restricted nodes and gain unauthorized access to the vulnerable application.Refer to DRUPAL-SA-CORE-2013-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0255.title: PostgreSQL enum_recv() denial of service
CVE-2013-0255.body: PostgreSQL is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper validation of input by the enum_recv() function. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted query to cause the server to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of PostgreSQL (8.3.23, 8.4.16, 9.0.12, 9.1.8, or 9.2.3 or later), available from the PostgreSQL Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-0269.title: json gem for Ruby security bypass
CVE-2013-0269.body: The json gem for Ruby could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the improper validation of input by the gem when parsing JSON documents. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass restrictions and execute SQL code on the system or cause a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of json gem for Ruby (1.7.7, 1.6.8, or 1.5.5 or later), available from the RubyGems Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2013-0289.title: isync SSL certificate information disclosure
CVE-2013-0289.body: isync could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the improper validation of SSL certificates when performing IMAP protocol based synchronization. By persuading a victim to visit a Web site containing a specially-crafted certificate, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using man-in-the-middle techniques to cause the victim to obtain sensitive information.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the isync GIT Repository. See References.

CVE-2013-0292.title: dbus-glib message sender privilege escalation
CVE-2013-0292.body: dbus-glib could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges, caused by the improper filtering of the message sender when the NameOwnerChanged signal was received. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain elevated privileges on the system.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2013-0293.title: oVirt Node lock screen security bypass
CVE-2013-0293.body: oVirt Node could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the failure to restrict access to locked system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions to access console or ssh session and gain unauthorized access to the vulnerable application.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-0308.title: GIT git-imap-send spoofing
CVE-2013-0308.body: GIT could allow a remote attacker to conduct spoofing attacks, caused by the improper verification of IMAP server hostname against the domain name in SSL certificates by git-imap-send. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability using man-in-the-middle techniques to spoof an SSL server and launch further attacks against a vulnerable target.Upgrade to the latest version of GIT (1.8.1.4 or later), available from the GIT Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-0336.title: 389 Directory Server username/dn denial of service
CVE-2013-0336.body: 389 Directory Server is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error when attempting to connect to the server with a missing username/dn. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (0001-Return-an-error-if-a-backend-does-not-support-transa.patch), available from the 389 Directory Server Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-0347.title: webfs webfsd.log information disclosure
CVE-2013-0347.body: webfs could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by insecure permissions being set on the webfsd.log file. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain access to a world-readable log file and obtain sensitive information.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-0452.title: IBM Tivoli Endpoint Manager Software Usage Analysis cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-0452.body: IBM Tivoli Endpoint Manager is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery (CSRF). The IBM Tivoli Endpoint Manager Software Usage Analysis (SUA) application uses a Flash interface. The Flash object uses the Action Message Format (AMF) to serialize messages between the web client and the SUA server. Attackers can execute an attack by crafting malicious Flash AMF messages and tricking an authenticated SUA user into visiting a web page under the attacker’s control. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1631350 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0453.title: IBM Tivoli Endpoint Manager Web Reports cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0453.body: IBM Tivoli Endpoint Manager is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Web Reports application. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1631351 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0454.title: IBM Storwize V7000 Unified CIFS options incorrect permissions
CVE-2013-0454.body: IBM Storwize V7000 Unified could apply incorrect permissions to data, caused by an error in the SMB2 server configuration. Under certain conditions, a wrong set of CIFS options could be applied to V7000 Unified CIFS exports. This could allow a remote authenticated attacker to gain read-write access to data that was configured as read only.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin S1004289 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2013-0457.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management uisessionid cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0457.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1625624 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0458.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Admin Console login cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0458.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input in the Admin Console. If security is disabled in the Admin Console login page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0460.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Admin Console portlet cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-0460.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server is vulnerable to a cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of portlets in the administrative console. By persuading a user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information, perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0461.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Admin Console VMM cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0461.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input in the administrative console for virtual member manager (VMM). A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject script into an error message, which could be executed in the console of another user.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0463.title: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway information disclosure
CVE-2013-0463.body: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway could allow a remote authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information that could possibly be used to launch further attacks against the affected system.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1640830 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0464.title: IBM Eclipse Help System cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0464.body: IBM Eclipse Help System, as used in multiple IBM products, is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-0466.title: IBM WebSphere Message Broker wsdl support cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0466.body: IBM WebSphere Message Broker is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input when wsdl support is enabled. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0467.title: IBM Eclipse Help System multiple products URL source code disclosure
CVE-2013-0467.body: IBM Eclipse Help System, as used in multiple IBM products, could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL to view source code on the help system server.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-0468.title: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator persistent cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0468.body: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute a script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1640830 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0473.title: IBM Rational AppScan and Policy Tester cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0473.body: IBM Rational AppScan and Policy Tester are vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a report to inject malicious script into the application, which would be executed in a victim's Web browser once the page is viewed. An attacker could potentially obtain temporary access to the user’s session. Specific knowledge of AppScan Enterprise is necessary to conduct the attack. The attack can be conducted over an adjacent network. No authentication is required for this attack.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1626264 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0474.title: IBM Rational AppScan and Policy Tester manual explore browser cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-0474.body: IBM Rational AppScan and Policy Tester are vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the manual explore browser. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web site with the manual explore browser plug-in, a remote attacker could capture platform credentials. This could lead to takeover of the test account being used for scanning. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0475.title: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway information disclosure
CVE-2013-0475.body: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway could allow a remote authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information that could possibly be used to launch further attacks against the affected system.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1640830 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0477.title: IBM InfoSphere Master Data Management Web content spoofing
CVE-2013-0477.body: IBM InfoSphere Master Data Management is vulnerable to content spoofing, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious content into a Web application page, which would appear to be legitimate and could be used to launch various attacks against users of the targeted Web application, including phishing, URL redirection, and cross-site request forgery.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1624952 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0478.title: IBM InfoSphere Master Data Management cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0478.body: IBM InfoSphere Master Data Management is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1624952 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0479.title: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway file manipulation
CVE-2013-0479.body: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway is vulnerable to file type or extension manipulation, which could cause improper handling of the file.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1640830 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0483.title: IBM IMS Enterprise Suite SOAP Gateway insecure authentication
CVE-2013-0483.body: The IBM IMS Enterprise Suite SOAP Gateway transmits login credentials in clear text during the authentication process. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using man-in-the-middle techniques to recover valid authentication credentials and gain access to the application. This login function in IMS Enterprise Suite SOAP Gateway has been present but not used by the program and hence has been removed from the product.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1631537 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0487.title: IBM Lotus Domino Java Console authentication bypass
CVE-2013-0487.body: A vulnerability in the Lotus Domino Java Console could allow a remote attacker to bypass authentication and gain elevated privileges. It is possible for an attacker with explicit knowledge of Domino server configuration to compromise time-limited authentication credentials when accessing the Domino Java Console.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1627597 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0492.title: IBM Informix Open Admin Tool cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0492.body: IBM Informix Open Admin Tool (OAT) is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1645601 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0494.title: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator HTTP byte range denial of service
CVE-2013-0494.body: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper handling of specially-crafted HTTP Range or Request-Range headers. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause memory and CPU exhaustion.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1627989 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0523.title: IBM WebSphere Commerce information disclosure
CVE-2013-0523.body: A vulnerability regarding weak encryption in IBM WebSphere Commerce could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker may be able to exploit this vulnerability to obtain a user's personal data.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1640597 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0526.title: IBM Global Console Manager command execution
CVE-2013-0526.body: A vulnerability in IBM Global Console Manager related to certain Web application variables not being sanitized could allow a remote attacker with a valid user ID and password to execute commands on the system with root privileges.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin MIGR-5093509 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0527.title: IBM Sterling Connect:Direct Browser session time-out information disclosure
CVE-2013-0527.body: IBM Sterling Connect:Direct Browser is vulnerable to unauthorized information disclosure as a result of C:D Browser pages being left open subsequent to idle session time-out. This could potentially expose sensitive data within the administrative console if the browser is visible and left unattended. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need access to an unlocked desktop of the administrative user.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1640356 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0529.title: IBM Sterling Connect:Direct Browser cookie information disclosure
CVE-2013-0529.body: IBM Sterling Connect:Direct Browser does not set the secure attribute when it creates a session cookie. The secure attribute is used to ensure that cookies (with the attribute set) can only be sent over an encrypted channel to reduce the likelihood of eavesdropping attacks.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0531.title: IBM Security AppScan Enterprise CVE-2013-0531 weak security
CVE-2013-0531.body: IBM Security AppScan Enterprise could provide weaker than expected security, caused by the supporting of SSL cipher suites that use weak encryption algorithms. An attacker may therefore be able to decrypt the secure communication between the client and the server, or successfully execute a man-in-the-middle attack on the client, enabling them to view sensitive information and perform actions on behalf of the client.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1640352 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0532.title: IBM Rational Appscan cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-0532.body: IBM Rational Appscan is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to the server on behalf of the victim. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1626264 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0533.title: IBM Lotus iNotes DOM-based cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0533.body: Sametime Links is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Lotus iNotes webmail interface. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the webmail interface for logged-in users, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1633620 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0535.body: IBM Classic Sametime Meetings Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1635185 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0537.title: IBM Lotus Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server link spoofing
CVE-2013-0537.body: IBM Lotus Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server is vulnerable to link spoofing. A user with permission to join a Sametime meeting can send spoofed links from any user to all members of the current meeting.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1654355 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0538.title: IBM Lotus Notes cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0538.body: IBM Lotus Notes is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input related to Java applet and JavaScript tags inside HTML emails. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0540.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server SSL security bypass
CVE-2013-0540.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server Liberty Profile could allow a remote attacker to bypass security caused by improper validation of authentication cookies. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and gain unauthorized access to resources. This does not occur when running SSL.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0541.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server denial of service
CVE-2013-0541.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a buffer overflow on Windows platforms with a localOS registry when using WebSphere Identity Manger (WIM). A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to potentially crash the Application Server.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0542.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0542.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Administrative console. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using specially-crafted field values to inject script into a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0543.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server security bypass
CVE-2013-0543.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server could allow a remote attacker to bypass security caused by improper validation of a user on HP, Linux and Solaris Platforms using Local OS registries.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0544.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server directory traversal
CVE-2013-0544.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on Linux or Unix Operating systems. A network attacker could exploit this vulnerability due to improper validation of input by the Administrative console.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0548.title: IBM Tivoli Monitoring multiple cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0548.body: IBM Tivoli Monitoring, as used in multiple IBM products, is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the "Basic Services" component. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0549.title: IBM WebSphere Portal Web Content Manager cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0549.body: IBM WebSphere Portal is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input in the Web Content Manager - Web Content Viewer Portlet. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials. Note: Pages that contain the deprecated version of the Web Content Viewer Portlet (that is based on the IBM Portlet API) are vulnerable to Cross-Site-Scripting attacks. This vulnerability does not affect the separate Web Content Viewer (JSR 286) Portlet.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1638984 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-0565.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Web2.0 and mobile toolkit cross-site scripting

CVE-2013-0578.title: IBM Sterling Order Management API information disclosure
CVE-2013-0578.body: IBM Sterling Order Management could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. CVE-2013-0579.body: An unspecified vulnerability in IBM InfoSphere Optim Data Growth for Oracle E-Business Suite could allow an attacker to gain unauthorized access to a user's Optim E-Business Console session. An attacker with access to a user's open browser before the user authenticates with the Optim E-Business Console or a browser left open after the user has authenticated, regardless of how long, can gather information to allow the attacker to impersonate that user including viewing sensitive information and performing any actions as available to the impersonated user in any environment that can access to the Optim E-Business Console.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651990 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. CVE-2013-0580.title: IBM InfoSphere Optim Data Growth for Oracle E-Business Suite cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-0580.body: IBM InfoSphere Optim Data Growth for Oracle E-Business Suite is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input in the Optim E-Business Console. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by tricking a legitimate user into opening a URL that results in an action being taken as that user, potentially without the knowledge of that user. Any actions taken require the user being tricked to either be previously authenticated or to authenticate as part of the attack.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651990 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. CVE-2013-1601.body: Multiple D-Link products could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by failure to restrict access on the lums.cgi script when processing live video stream. OpenJPA usage by itself does not introduce the vulnerability.For IBM WebSphere Application Server: Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. Note: The OpenJPA code ships with the WebSphere Application Server, but WebSphere Application Server is NOT vulnerable to this issue. We recommend installing this fix or upgrading to a fix pack that contains this code as a proactive safeguard to ensure your environment is as secure as possible. CVE-2013-1911.body: RubyGems ldoce (Longman Dictionary of Contemporary English) could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by the improper validation of input by word.rb. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted mp3 URL to inject and execute arbitrary commands on the system.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-1920.title: Xen code execution
CVE-2013-1920.body: Xen could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error when extending the per-domain event channel tracking table. If the hypervisor is under memory pressure and XSM (Xen Security Module) is enabled, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system.Refer to XSA-47 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-1923.title: Red Hat nfs-utils package spoofing
CVE-2013-1923.body: The Red Hat nfs-utils package could allow a remote attacker to conduct spoofing attacks, caused by the dependency on PTR resolution for GSSAPI authentication by rpc.gssd. A remote attacker with the ability to trick rpc.gssd into talking to an unintended server could exploit this vulnerability to spoof DNS content and launch further attacks on the system.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the nfs-utils GIT Repository. See References.

CVE-2013-1925.title: Chaos tool suite (ctools) module for Drupal node security bypass
CVE-2013-1925.body: Chaos tool suite (ctools) module for Drupal could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper verification of user access permissions on nodes. An attacker having "access content" permission could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions to view restricted nodes titles and obtain other sensitive information.Refer to SA-CONTRIB-2013-041 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. CVE-2013-1930.title: MantisBT Close button security bypass
CVE-2013-1930.body: MantisBT could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error in the workflow restrictions. CVE-2013-1952.title: Xen denial of service
CVE-2013-1952.body: Xen is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error related to remapping table entries for MSI interrupts set up by bridge devices. CVE-2013-1967.body: MediaElement.js is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the flashmediaelement.swf file. CVE-2013-2757.title: Citrix CloudPlatform security bypass
CVE-2013-2757.body: Citrix CloudPlatform could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the failure to properly restrict access to VNC ports on the management network. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized access to VNC ports without providing authentication credentials.Refer to CTX135815 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For Apache CloudStack: Upgrade to the latest version of CloudStack (4.0.2 or later), available from the Apache Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-2776.title: Todd Miller sudo tty_tickets security bypass
CVE-2013-2776.body: Todd Miller sudo could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error related to the tty_tickets option and control of the terminal-specific time stamp file behavior. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to run commands without having proper authentication.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2013-2777.title: Todd Miller sudo tty_tickets security bypass
CVE-2013-2777.body: Todd Miller sudo could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error related to the tty_tickets option and control of the terminal-specific time stamp file behavior. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to run commands without having proper authentication.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2013-2945.title: b2evolution admin.php SQL injection
CVE-2013-2945.body: b2evolution is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the admin.php script using the show_statuses parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of b2evolution (4.1.7 or later), available from the b2evolution Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-2950.title: IBM WebSphere Portal HTTP response splitting
CVE-2013-2950.body: IBM WebSphere Portal is vulnerable to HTTP response splitting when home substitution is enabled (disabled by default). An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to set arbitrary content in the second response, giving control over the appearance of the content rendered.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1638864 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2955.title: IBM InfoSphere Optim Data Growth for Oracle E-Business Suite cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-2955.body: IBM InfoSphere Optim Data Growth for Oracle E-Business Suite is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1637444 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2956.title: IBM InfoSphere Optim Data Growth for Oracle E-Business Suite SQL injection
CVE-2013-2956.body: IBM InfoSphere Optim Data Growth for Oracle E-Business Suite is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements using an unspecified parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1637444 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2957.title: IBM InfoSphere Optim Data Growth for Oracle E-Business Suite cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-2957.body: IBM InfoSphere Optim Data Growth for Oracle E-Business Suite is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1637444 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2960.title: IBM Tivoli Monitoring KDSMAIN denial of service
CVE-2013-2960.body: IBM Tivoli Monitoring, as used in multiple IBM products, is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by a buffer overflow in KDSMAIN. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL to cause a denial of service.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2961.title: IBM Tivoli Monitoring URL redirect
CVE-2013-2961.body: An unspecified vulnerability in IBM Tivoli Monitoring, as used in multiple IBM products, could allow a remote attacker to redirect arbitrary HTTP requests and bypass proxy settings without detection.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2962.title: IBM WebSphere Transformation Extender Launcher denial of service
CVE-2013-2962.body: WebSphere Transformation Extender Launcher is vulnerable to a denial of service attack whereby a local unauthorized user could crash the Launcher process, or prohibit Launcher Admin Console operational commands from reaching the Launcher by causing a buffer overflow. While this exploit could impact availability of the Launcher, the integrity of the data and the confidentiality of information are not compromised.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1662870 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2964.title: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager buffer overflow
CVE-2013-2964.body: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the TSM UNIX/Linux clients. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized root privileges on the system.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651120 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2967.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Administrative console cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-2967.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server could allow a cross-site scripting attack, caused by improper validation of input in the Administrative console. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to inject script into a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2968.title: IBM Sterling Control Center denial of service
CVE-2013-2968.body: IBM Sterling Control Center (SCC) is vulnerable to a denial of service. If an authenticated remote attacker causes SCC to read a file and the file is large and has no EOL characters, the attacker could cause a denial of service.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1640348 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2969.title: IBM Sterling Control Center cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-2969.body: IBM Sterling Control Center (SCC) is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1640348 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2974.title: IBM Tivoli Application Dependency Discovery Manager (TADDM) SQL injection
CVE-2013-2974.body: IBM Tivoli Application Dependency Discovery Manager (TADDM) is vulnerable to SQL injection. It is possible to bypass authorization in the application via parameters manipulation in the BIRT reporting URL. That allow any user to obtain report administration functionality, thereby allowing them to create/delete reports or exploit vulnerabilities such as SQL injection that exists in the BIRT viewer.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1662955 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2976.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Administrative console information disclosure
CVE-2013-2976.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by incorrect caching by the Administrative console.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2977.title: IBM Notes PNG integer overflow
CVE-2013-2977.body: IBM Notes is vulnerable to an integer overflow caused by improper parsing of PNG image files. By sending an email containing a specially-crafted PNG image file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system. Because this vulnerability can be triggered by simply viewing an email in the preview window, it can be exploited without any interaction required.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1635878 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2978.title: IBM Cognos Business Intelligence Report Author information disclosure 1
CVE-2013-2978.body: IBM Cognos Business Intelligence could allow a remote authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information. A malicious user may be able to download files from the server that they are not intended to have access to. The attacker must be an authenticated user with Report Author privileges and must know the exact path and filename of the file attempting to be accessed.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1645566 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2979.title: IBM InfoSphere Optim Performance Manager directory traversal
CVE-2013-2979.body: IBM InfoSphere Optim Performance Manager could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. A remotely authenticated attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to traverse directories and view potentially sensitive system files, if the InfoSphere Optim Performance Manager server process has been started with an Operating System credential that has read privileges on the file accessed by the attacker.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2980.title: IBM Data Studio Web Console cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-2980.body: IBM Data Studio is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Web Console. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.Refer to IBM Security Advisory 1638733 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2981.title: IBM Data Studio Web Console directory traversal
CVE-2013-2981.body: IBM Data Studio could allow a remote authenticated attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to traverse directories and view arbitrary files on the system.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1638734 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2984.title: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway path traversal
CVE-2013-2984.body: A path traversal vulnerability in IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway could allow a remote authenticated attacker to bypass restrictions and gain access to restricted files.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1640830 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2985.title: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway information disclosure
CVE-2013-2985.body: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway could allow a remote authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information that could possibly be used to launch further attacks against the affected system.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1640830 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2987.title: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway information disclosure
CVE-2013-2987.body: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway could allow a remote authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information that could possibly be used to launch further attacks against the affected system.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1640830 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2989.title: IBM Sterling Connect:Direct for UNIX privilege escalation
CVE-2013-2989.body: A vulnerability in IBM Sterling Connect:Direct for UNIX could allow a local user to gain elevated privileges. A user who has been successfully authenticated by Connect:Direct for UNIX executes Connect:Direct for UNIX’s file copying functionality with elevated file system privileges. An authenticated user can exploit the vulnerability to bypass file system permissions and read or overwrite files with. The vulnerability only occurs on AIX 6.1 and later.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1637561 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-2992.title: IBM WebSphere Commerce search functionality denial of service
CVE-2013-2992.body: IBM WebSphere Commerce Search is vulnerable to a denial of service attack. Depending on how search term associations are configured, a remote attacker could use a specially-crafted query that could impact site availability. Note: This vulnerability does not apply if WebSphere Commerce is integrated with a third party search engine.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1648644 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3025.title: IBM Rational Focal Point cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3025.body: IBM Rational Focal Point is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted HTTP POST request to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1652479 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3026.title: IBM iNotes ActiveX control integer overflow
CVE-2013-3026.body: IBM iNotes could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an integer overflow in the DWA9W ActiveX control. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1645503 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3027.title: IBM iNotes ActiveX control integer overflow
CVE-2013-3027.body: IBM iNotes could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an integer overflow in the DWA9W ActiveX control. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1645503 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3028.title: IBM WebSphere MQ mqm buffer overflow
CVE-2013-3028.body: IBM WebSphere MQ is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking in multiple MQ server control commands. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with MQ administrator privileges through setuid on UNIX platforms or adopted authority on IBM i.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1639001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3029.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Administrative console cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-3029.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server is vulnerable to a cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of input in the administrative console. By persuading a user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information, perform cross-site scripting attacks, and other malicious activities.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3030.title: IBM Cognos Business Intelligence servlet gateway denial of service
CVE-2013-3030.body: The IBM Cognos Business Intelligence servlet gateway is vulnerable to a denial of service. A remote attacker may be able to send specially-crafted HTTP requests to the IBM Cognos Business Intelligence servlet gateway and stop it from accepting further requests for a period of time, effectively causing a denial of service to users of the system.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1652590 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3032.title: IBM iNotes cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3032.body: IBM iNotes is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1645503 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3033.title: IBM Tivoli Remote Control SQL injection
CVE-2013-3033.body: IBM Tivoli Remote Control is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote authenticated attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3034.title: IBM InfoSphere Information Server HTML cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3034.body: IBM InfoSphere Information Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to gain unauthorized access or collect sensitive information.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-3035.title: IBM AIX inet denial of service
CVE-2013-3035.body: IBM AIX is vulnerable to a denial of service attack. If an AIX system has IPv6 address configured, and if a malformed IPv6 packet in a specific format is sent to that system, the system could hang while processing that packet. The problem could happen only if an IPv6 address is configured on any of the network interfaces.Refer to the IBM AIX Security Advisory for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3036.title: IBM Rational Requirements Composer URL spoofing
CVE-2013-3036.body: A URL spoofing vulnerability in IBM Rational Requirements Composer could allow a remote attacker to conduct phishing attacks against legitimate users.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1645927 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3037.title: IBM Rational Requrements Composer privilege escalation
CVE-2013-3037.body: An unspecified vulnerability in IBM Rational Requirements Composer could allow a local attacker to execute code with elevated privileges.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1645927 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3039.title: IBM Rational Requirements Composer insecure authentication
CVE-2013-3039.body: An unspecified vulnerability in IBM Rational Requirements Composer could insecurely perform authentication.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1645927 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3040.title: IBM InfoSphere Information Server information disclosure
CVE-2013-3040.body: A vulnerability in the IBM InfoSphere Information Server login mechanism could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. Failed login attempts separately identify invalid usernames and passwords enabling sequential brute force attempts to identify valid usernames and passwords.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-3042.title: IBM Rational Software Architect Design Manager and Rhapsody Design Manager directory traversal 1
CVE-2013-3042.body: IBM Rational Software Architect Design Manager and Rhapsody Design Manager directory traversal could allow a local attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain access to arbitrary files outside of the restricted path. Note: This is a different vulnerability than the one described by CVE-2013-3043.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1655724 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3043.title: IBM Rational Software Architect Design Manager and Rhapsody Design Manager directory traversal 2
CVE-2013-3043.body: IBM Rational Software Architect Design Manager and Rhapsody Design Manager directory traversal could allow a local attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain access to arbitrary files outside of the restricted path. Note: This is a different vulnerability than the one described by CVE-2013-3042.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1655724 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3044.title: IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server message spoofing
CVE-2013-3044.body: IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server is vulnerable to message spoofing. A user with permission to join a Sametime meeting can spoof messages from a user or post anonymous messages into the chat session.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1654355 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3045.title: IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting server open redirect
CVE-2013-3045.body: IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting server is vulnerable to an open redirect. A malicious user may use this ability to share a malicious link with other users through the Library function.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1654355 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3046.title: IBM Sametime Meeting Server weak security
CVE-2013-3046.body: The HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security) is not used. This header informs supported browsers that the site should only be accessed over an SSL-protected connection (HTTPS). This may enable an attacker to utilize the initial HTTP connection and redirection in order to perform a man in the middle attack (MITM).Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-3048.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management portlet cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3048.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input when adding a script to a portlet. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651085 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3050.title: ZAPms pid parameter SQL injection
CVE-2013-3050.body: ZAPms is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements using the pid parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-3081.title: Jojo CMS X-Forwarded-For header SQL injection
CVE-2013-3081.body: Jojo CMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements using an HTTP request containing the X-Forwarded-For header, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Jojo CMS (1.2.2 or later), available from the GitHub Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3082.title: Jojo CMS forgot-password module cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3082.body: Jojo CMS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the forgot-password module. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the search parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Jojo CMS (1.2.2 or later), available from the GitHub Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3084.title: Belkin F5D8236-4 Router unspecified cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3084.body: Belkin F5D8236-4 Router is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-3087.title: Belkin Advance N900 Dual-Band Wireless Router unspecified cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3087.body: Belkin Advance N900 Dual-Band Wireless Router is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-3090.title: Belkin N300 Wi-Fi N Router unspecified cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3090.body: Belkin N300 Wi-Fi N Router is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-3097.title: Actiontec MI424WR router for Verizon FiOS cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3097.body: The Actiontec MI424WR router for Verizon FiOS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-3213.title: Vtiger CRM multiple SQL injection
CVE-2013-3213.body: Vtiger CRM is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to multiple scripts using multiple parameters, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the Vtiger CRM Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3215.title: Vtiger CRM validateSession() security bypass
CVE-2013-3215.body: Vtiger CRM could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper validation of authentication mechanisms by the validateSession() function within multiple scripts. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using empty username and sessionid parameters to bypass security restrictions and gain unauthorized administrative access to the vulnerable application.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the Vtiger CRM Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3246.title: XnView xnview.exe XCF file buffer overflow
CVE-2013-3246.body: XnView is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the xnview.exe when processing image layers of XCF files. By persuading a vicitm to open a specially-crafted XCF file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of XnView (2.03 or later), available from the XnView Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3247.title: XnView xnwiew.exe RLE layer XCF file buffer overflow
CVE-2013-3247.body: XnView is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the xnview.exe when processing the RLE compressed layers of XCF files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted XCF file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of XnView (2.03 or later), available from the XnView Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3249.title: DameWare Remote Support DWExporter.exe buffer overflow
CVE-2013-3249.body: DameWare Remote Support is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the DWExporter.exe when importing data. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the "Add from text file" feature to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the DameWare Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3256.title: SexyBookmarks plugin for WordPress unspecified cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-3256.body: SexyBookmarks plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to perform unauthorized actions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-3258.title: Digg Digg plugin for WordPress HTTP request cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-3258.body: Digg Digg plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to perform cross-site request forgery attacks. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Upgrade to the latest version of Digg Digg plugin for WordPress (5.3.5 or later), available from the WordPress Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3259.title: Zoom Player BMP file buffer overflow
CVE-2013-3259.body: Zoom Player is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when parsing BMP files. By persuading a vicitm to open a specially-crafted BMP file containing an overly large biClrUsed value, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerablity to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Zoom Player (8.7 beta 11 or later), available from the Zoom Player Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3260.title: Zoom Player BMP file buffer overflow
CVE-2013-3260.body: Zoom Player is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when parsing BMP files. By persuading a vicitm to open a specially-crafted BMP file containing an overly large biClrUsed value, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Zoom Player (8.7 beta 11 or later), available from the Zoom Player Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3262.title: Download Monitor plugin for WordPress admin.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3262.body: Download Monitor plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the admin.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'p' and sort parameters in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Download Monitor plugin for WordPress (3.3.6.2 or later), available from the WordPress Plugin Directory Web site.
