CVE-2013-3268.title: Novell iManager unspecified
CVE-2013-3268.body: An unspecified error in Novell iManager related to the failure to refresh a token after a logout action has an unknown impact and remote attack vector.Refer to Novell Document ID 7010166 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3269.title: Cybozu Office CVE-2013-3269 cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-3269.body: Cybozu Office is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to perform unauthorized actions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Upgrade to the latest version of Cybozu Office (8.1.6 or 9.3.0 or later), available from the Cybozu Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3294.title: Exponent CMS CVE-2013-3294 index.php SQL injection
CVE-2013-3294.body: Exponent CMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the src and username parameters, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Exponent CMS (v2.2.0 RC1 or later), available from the Expoennt CMS Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3319.title: SAP NetWeaver CVE-2013-3319 information disclosure
CVE-2013-3319.body: SAP NetWeaver could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error in the SAP Host Control Service. By sending a specially-crafted SOAP request to TCP port 1128, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain internal operating system information.Refer to SAP Security Note 1816536 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3320.title: NetApp OnCommand System Manager CVE-2013-3320 admin page cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3320.body: NetApp OnCommand System Manager is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the admin page. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the full-name and comment fields to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of NetApp OnCommand System Manager (2.2 or later), available from the NetApp OnCommand System Manager Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3320.title: NetApp OnCommand System Manager CVE-2013-3320 multiple cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3320.body: NetApp OnCommand System Manager is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the admin, CIFS configuration and Storage pages. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the domain-name, value and comment parameters in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of NetApp OnCommand System Manager (2.2 or later), available from the NetApp OnCommand System Manager Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3322.title: NetApp OnCommand System Manager CVE-2013-3322 Halt/Reboot interface command execution
CVE-2013-3322.body: NetApp OnCommand System Manager could allow a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input in the Halt/Reboot interface. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the system.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-3323.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management WebSeal session hijacking
CVE-2013-3323.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management could allow a remote attacker to hijack a valid user's session, caused by a failure to invalidate the authentication session when WebSeal with Basic Authentication is used. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized access to the application.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651085 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3414.title: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliances cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3414.body: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliances is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the WebVPN portal login page. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to Cisco Security Notice for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3422.title: Cisco Secure Access Control System CVE-2013-3422 cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3422.body: Cisco Secure Access Control System is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Administration pages. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unspecified parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to Cisco Security Notice for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. CVE-2013-3424.title: Cisco Secure Access Control System CVE-2013-3424 cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-3424.body: Cisco Secure Access Control System is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Administration and View pages. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Refer to Cisco Security Notice for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. CVE-2013-3425.title: Cisco WebEx Meeting Center information disclosure
CVE-2013-3425.body: Cisco WebEx could allow a remote authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the generation of different error messages by the Meeting Center component for invalid file access attempts depending on whether a file exists. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a series of SPI calls to enumerate files.Refer to Cisco Security Notice for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3429.title: Cisco Video Surveillance Manager directory traversal
CVE-2013-3429.body: Cisco Video Surveillance Manager could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to a number of pages containing directory traversal sequences to view arbitrary files on the system.Refer to cisco-sa-20130724-vsm for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3430.title: Cisco Video Surveillance Manager CVE-2013-3430 information disclosure
CVE-2013-3430.body: Cisco Video Surveillance Manager could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to create, modify and remove camera feeds, archives, logs and users.Refer to cisco-sa-20130724-vsm for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3431.title: Cisco Video Surveillance Manager CVE-2013-3431 information disclosure
CVE-2013-3431.body: Cisco Video Surveillance Manager could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to create, modify and remove camera feeds, archives, logs and users.Refer to cisco-sa-20130724-vsm for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3436.title: Cisco IOS CVE-2013-3436 security bypass
CVE-2013-3436.body: Cisco IOS could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the use of an improper mechanism for enabling Group Domain of Interpretation (GDOI) traffic flow by the default configuration of the Group Encrypted Transport VPN (GET VPN) feature. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using UDP as the transport protocol and port 848 as either the source or destination to bypass encryption policies.Refer to Cisco Security Notice for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3443.title: Cisco Wide Area Application Services framework code execution
CVE-2013-3443.body: Cisco Wide Area Application Services (WAAS) could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error in the Web service framework code when configured as Central Manager (CM). By sending a specially-crafted POST request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system.Refer to cisco-sa-20130731-waascm for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3444.title: Multiple Cisco content network and video delivery products framework command execution
CVE-2013-3444.body: Multiple Cisco content network and video delivery products could allow a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by an error in the Web framework. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary commands on the system.Refer to cisco-sa-20130731-cm for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3445.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine CVE-2013-3445 denial of service
CVE-2013-3445.body: Cisco Identity Services Engine is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by insufficient implementation of the firewall rule to protect some open ports. By flooding the system with malformed IP packets, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to consume an overly large amount of CPU resources.Refer to Cisco Security Notice for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3457.title: Cisco Finesse interface information disclosure
CVE-2013-3457.body: Cisco Finesse could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an absolute path traversal in the Web interface. See References.

CVE-2013-3474.body: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper validation of specific parameters by the Web Administrator Interface. CVE-2013-3945.title: IrfanView Formats PlugIn MrSID.dll code execution
CVE-2013-3945.body: IrfanView Formats PlugIn could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error in the MrSID.DLL plugin when parsing nband tags. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted SID file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of IrfanView Formats PlugIn (4.37 or later), available from the IrfanView Formats PlugIn Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3946.title: IrfanView Formats PlugIn MrSID.dll buffer overflow
CVE-2013-3946.body: IrfanView Formats PlugIn is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by MrSID.dll when parsing the levels header. By persuading victim to open a specially-crafted SID file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of IrfanView Formats PlugIn (4.37 or later), available from the IrfanView Formats PlugIn Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3947.title: AhnLab V3 Internet Security MedCoreD.sys privilege escalation
CVE-2013-3947.body: AhnLab V3 Internet Security is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the MedCoreD.sys driver. By sending specially-crafted IOCTL requests, a local attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges.Upgrade to the latest version of V3 Internet Security (2014.01.22.00 or later), available from the AhnLab Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3961.title: Simple PHP Agenda eventid parameter SQL injection
CVE-2013-3961.body: Simple PHP Agenda is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the edit_event.php script using the eventid parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Simple PHP Agenda (2.2.9 or later), available from the Simple PHP Agenda Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-3971.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management invoice details security bypass
CVE-2013-3971.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management could allow a remote authenticated attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the displaying of duplicate line information by the Invoice Details report. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensiitive information.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651085 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3972.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management reports information disclosure
CVE-2013-3972.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management could allow a remote authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error when running or scheduling a report. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain database credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651085 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3973.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management SQL injection
CVE-2013-3973.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651085 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3976.title: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager for Mail mailbox restore information disclosure
CVE-2013-3976.body: Due to a problem in the Data Protection for Exchange and FlashCopy Manager for Exchange components, once a mailbox is restored into a .PST file, each individual .PST file will be created as expected, but the contents of that .PST file may not be the contents associated with that mailbox name.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1644407 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3977.title: IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server information disclosure
CVE-2013-3977.body: Taking a list of known users in IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server, it is possible to discover a list of meeting rooms owned by a specific user without authentication.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-3978.title: IBM Sametime Meeting Server information disclosure
CVE-2013-3978.body: IBM Sametime Meeting Server contains an information disclosure. The web application provides no directives regarding the caching of displayed information within the browser of proxy servers between the user and the application. This could result in a local user obtaining information they should not have access to.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-3979.title: IBM Cognos Star Command Center cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3979.body: IBM Cognos Star Command Center is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input in the online help pages. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1643067 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3980.title: IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server denial of service
CVE-2013-3980.body: An attacker could cause a denial of service of IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server by flooding a meeting room with bogus users until the meeting becomes unusable.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-3981.title: IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server information disclosure
CVE-2013-3981.body: It is possible for an unauthenticated user to extract photos/avatars of users from the Sametime system.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-3982.title: IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server information disclosure
CVE-2013-3982.body: IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server includes a public page that exposes technical information about the system used and the installation details to an unauthorized users.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-3983.title: IBM Sametime Meeting Server Unvalidated Redirect URL in a Cookie
CVE-2013-3983.body: The value stored within a cookie is used after logon to redirect the user. This value is not suitably validated and can therefore be used for users redirection.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-3984.title: IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server information disclosure
CVE-2013-3984.body: Cookies are used to transport contents usually used to identify session state or other settings in web applications, therefore should be appropriately secured. Cookies used in secure connections should not be able to be transferred over unencrypted channel and not be readable by client side scripting languages in browsers if not needed.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-3985.title: IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server information disclosure
CVE-2013-3985.body: IBM Sametime Enterprise Meeting Server could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. The Domain variable used to restrict application cookies is not tightly set and may result in exposed session variables .Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1654355 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3986.title: IBM Lotus Sametime WebPlayer denial of service
CVE-2013-3986.body: IBM Sametime is vulnerable to a denial of service. An attacker participating in a Sametime Audio Visual (AV) session may be able to crash the IBM Sametime WebPlayer extension (Firefox extension) session of other users.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1654041 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3988.title: IBM Sametime Meeting Server clickjacking
CVE-2013-3988.body: The web application does not set the "X-Frame-Options" header and is therefore open to click- jacking style attacks.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-3989.title: IBM AppScan Enterprise database password information disclosure
CVE-2013-3989.body: IBM AppScan Enterprise could allow a remote authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information. The password value for the AppScan Source database is sent in a response from AppScan Enterprise in a non-encrypted format. This may allow an attacker to successfully execute a "man-in-the-middle" attack on the client.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1653287 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3990.title: IBM iNotes cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3990.body: IBM iNotes is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1645503 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3992.body: IBM InfoSphere BigInsights is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading a user into inserting a malformed URL address into a browser or clicking on a malformed URL link, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized access or collect sensitive information.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1645804 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3993.title: IBM InfoSphere BigInsights directory traversal
CVE-2013-3993.body: Certain BigInsights APIs accept input parameters without parameter validation. These parameters can be manipulated to point to directories and files that the user does not have the right to access or that might contain malicious data/code.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1677445 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3995.title: IBM InfoSphere BigInsights cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3995.body: IBM InfoSphere BigInsights is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to gain unauthorized access or collect sensitive information.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1645804 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3997.title: IBM InfoSphere BigInsights Web Application Enterprise Console open redirect
CVE-2013-3997.body: The InfoSphere BigInsights Web Application Enterprise Console allows open redirects, which enable it to be used to redirect to a malicious site making phishing attacks easier.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1667812 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3998.title: IBM InfoSphere BigInsights Web Application Enterprise Console response splitting
CVE-2013-3998.body: The InfoSphere BigInsights Web Application Enterprise Console does not prevent HTTP response splitting. HTTP response splitting can be used to initiate a variety of attacks including cross-user defacement, cache poisoning, cross-site scripting, and page hijacking. Some of these issues can lead to an attacker gaining unauthorized access or collecting sensitive information.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1667812 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-3999.title: IBM Social Media Analytics Platform cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-3999.body: IBM Social Media Analytics Platform is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1644427 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4000.title: IBM Cognos Command Center cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-4000.body: IBM Cognos Command Center is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1657932 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4001.title: IBM Cognos Command Center session fixation
CVE-2013-4001.body: IBM Cognos Command Center is vulnerable to session fixation. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to hijack a valid user's session and perform actions on behalf of the victim.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1657932 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4003.title: IBM TRIRIGA Application Platform cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4003.body: Cross-Site Scripting vulnerabilities may enable malicious scripts to be injected into certain URLs. Customers on certain versions of the IBM TRIRIGA Application Platform are potentially impacted by these vulnerabilities, which can cause various issues including but not limited to broken pages or application functionality, and the ability to forward data from the page to an external (unauthorized) site.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4004.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Administrative console cross-site scripting 1
CVE-2013-4004.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of input in the Administrative Console. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to inject script into the victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4005.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Administrative console cross-site scripting 2
CVE-2013-4005.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server could allow a cross-site scripting attack, caused by improper validation of input in the Administrative console. A network attacker could exploit this vulnerability using specially-crafted field values to inject script into a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4006.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Liberty Profile information disclosure
CVE-2013-4006.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server Liberty Profile could allow an authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information due to insecure permissions of files created by the Liberty Server. Liberty Profile server files and directories created prior to applying this fix pack should be secured by using the "chmod" command to turn off access permissions for the "other" category.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651880 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4012.title: IBM WebSphere Portal Content Template Catalog code execution
CVE-2013-4012.body: If IBM Content Template Catalog 4.0 for WebSphere Portal, a vulnerability exists that could allow a remote authenticated attacker to execute code on the system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to install and execute Portal Application Archive (PAA) files.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1660011 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4014.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management clickjacking
CVE-2013-4014.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management could allow a remote attacker to hijack the clicking action of the victim, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted request to hijack the victim's click actions.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651085 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4015.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer sandbox bypass
CVE-2013-4015.body: A vulnerability in the Microsoft Internet Explorer sandbox (Protected Mode and Enhanced Protected Mode) could allow code running in the sandbox to evade the elevation policy check, which could result in privilege escalation.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References. — OR — Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2013-4016.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management SQL injection
CVE-2013-4016.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-4017.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management SQL injection
CVE-2013-4017.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote authenticated attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651085 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4019.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4019.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651085 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4024.title: IBM Data Studio Web Console non-encrypted cookies
CVE-2013-4024.body: A vulnerability in the Web Console application in IBM Data Studio Web Console, Optim Performance Manager, InfoSphere Optim Configuration Manager, and DB2 Recovery Expert for Linux, UNIX and Windows could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. If the Web Console application is accessed via a network with HTTP, an attacker using man-in-the-middle techniques could recover packets for non-encrypted cookies that could potentially contain sensitive session information.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1650504 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4025.title: IBM Data Studio auto-complete insecure
CVE-2013-4025.body: IBM Data Studio Web Console, Optim Performance Manager, InfoSphere Optim Configuration Manager, and DB2 Recovery Expert for Linux, UNIX and Windows could allow a local attacker to gain unauthorized access to a user's authenticated Web browser session due to the usage of the Web browser "Auto-Complete" feature. If a user's Web browser is configured to store form information, the browser's "Auto-Complete" stores completed form fields, such as the Web console login passwords. An attacker with physical access to the client system from which the browser is launched may be able to access the password if the browser does not use sufficient security for local storage.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1650504 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4027.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management security bypass
CVE-2013-4027.body: An unspecified error in IBM Maximo Asset Management could allow a remote authenticated attacker to bypass security restrictions and gain access to the system.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651085 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4032.title: IBM DB2 FCM denial of service
CVE-2013-4032.body: A vulnerability in IBM DB2 could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service. The vulnerability exists in the Fast Communications Manager (FCM), which is used for communication between different nodes in a Partitioned database and between members in a pureScale configuration. A single node configuration is not vulnerable.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1650231 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4034.title: IBM Cognos Business Intelligence XML external entity information disclosure
CVE-2013-4034.body: IBM Cognos Business Intelligence is vulnerable to an XML external entity attack. A remote authenticated attacker could send specially-crafted XML data to the IBM Cognos Business Intelligence server in order to gain unauthorized access to files from the server.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1652590 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4036.title: IBM InfoSphere Master Data Management cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4036.body: IBM InfoSphere Master Data Management is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1624952 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4038.title: IBM Integrated Management Module IPMI cleartext passwords
CVE-2013-4038.body: The Integrated Management Module (IMM) used by multiple IBM servers store the passwords for user accounts in clear text in the IMM file system. Users do not have access to the root shell of the IMM’s operating system, however if a user was able to break into the IMM operating system, he would have visibility to the user passwords. With access to the account information a malicious user could change the account credentials of other users or perform actions under the guise of another user.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin MIGR-5093463 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4039.title: IBM WebSphere Extended Deployment Compute Grid information disclosure
CVE-2013-4039.body: IBM WebSphere Extended Deployment Compute Grid could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. This vulnerability could be leveraged to gain unauthorized access to jobs.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-4043.title: IBM SPSS Collaboration and Deployment Services informtion disclosure
CVE-2013-4043.body: IBM SPSS Collaboration and Deployment Services could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to disclose arbitrary file content.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1661169 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4050.title: ZeroShell kerbynet.cgi directory traversal
CVE-2013-4050.body: ZeroShell could allow a local attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the /cgi-bin/kerbynet.cgi script containing dot dot sequences (/../) in the Object parameter to view arbitrary files on the system and obtain sensitive information. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.Upgrade to the latest version of ZeroShell (2.0RC3 or later), available from the ZeroShell Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-4051.title: IBM Domino Web Administrator cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4051.body: IBM Domino Web Administrator is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1652988 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4052.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server UUDI cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4052.body: WebSphere Application Server could allow a cross-site scripting attack, caused by improper validation of input in the UDDI Administrative console. A network attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to inject script into a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4053.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server privilege escalation
CVE-2013-4053.body: WebSphere Application Server using WS-Security and configured for XML Digital Signature using trust store, could allow a network attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by improper checking of the certificate.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4054.title: IBM WebSphere MQ Telemetry file access
CVE-2013-4054.body: WebSphere MQ Telemetry provides the ability to serve web applications via HTTP requests. These web applications are served from a configurable WebContent directory. A specially formed URI request could allow an attacker to access files outside of the configured WebContent directory. This means that with the right URI you can read any file on the filesystem which is readable by the mqm user - not just the intended files in the sandbox.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1664550 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4056.title: IBM InfoSphere Information Server Data Quality Console and Information Analyzer cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-4056.body: IBM InfoSphere Information Server Data Quality Console and Information Analyzer is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to trick a legitimate user into opening a URL that results in an action being taken as that user, potentially without the knowledge of that user. Any actions taken require the user being tricked to either be previously authenticated or to authenticate as part of the attack.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1652413 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4058.title: IBM Infosphere Information Server SQL injection
CVE-2013-4058.body: Information Server’s metadata repository is exposed to blind SQL injection attacks through various Information Server web interfaces.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-4059.title: IBM Infosphere Information Server cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4059.body: Various Information Server web interfaces are vulnerable to content-spoofing and cross-site scripting allowing attackers to gain unauthorized access or collect sensitive information.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-4061.title: IBM AppScan Enterprise and Rational Policy Tester privilege escalation
CVE-2013-4061.body: IBM AppScan Enterprise and Rational Policy Tester could allow a remote authenticated attacker to gain elevated privileges on the application. Unauthorized users have the ability to update allowed hosts used for authentication. This can be used to facilitate spoofing through URL redirection.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4062.title: IBM AppScan Enterprise and Rational Policy Tester invalid certificate man-in-the-middle
CVE-2013-4062.body: IBM AppScan Enterprise and Rational Policy Tester provides weaker than expected security when connections are made to a Jazz Team Server. Connections are allowed to a Jazz Team Server with untrusted SSL certificate. This may allow an attacker to successfully execute a "man-in-the-middle" attack on the client.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4063.title: IBM iNotes email message active content cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4063.body: IBM iNotes is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of active content within an email message. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials or other sensitive information.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1659959 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4064.title: IBM iNotes ultra-light mode persistent cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4064.body: IBM iNotes is vulnerable to cross-site scripting in the ultra-light mode, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute malicious script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials or other sensitive information.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1659959 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4065.title: IBM iNotes ultra-light mode reflected cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4065.body: IBM iNotes is vulnerable to cross-site scripting in the ultra-light mode, caused by improper validation of active content within an email message. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials or other sensitive information.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1659959 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4067.title: IBM InfoSphere Information Server cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4067.body: IBM InfoSphere Information Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-4069.title: IBM SPSS Collaboration and Deployment Services XML external entity information disclosure
CVE-2013-4069.body: The IBM SPSS Collaboration and Deployment Services Deployment Portal application is vulnerable to an XML external entity attack. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information, which could be used to launch further attacks against the system.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1660191 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4070.title: IBM SPSS Collaboration and Deployment Services internal password information disclosure
CVE-2013-4070.body: The IBM SPSS Collaboration and Deployment Services Deployment portal application could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain an internal password, which could be used to launch further attacks against the systemRefer to IBM Security Bulletin 1660191 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4115.title: Squid idnsALookup() buffer overflow
CVE-2013-4115.body: Squid is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the idnsALookup() function. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP request, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Refer to SQUID-2013:2 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4117.title: Category Grid View Gallery plugin for WordPress CatGridPost.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4117.body: Category Grid View Gallery plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the CatGridPost.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the ID parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-4124.title: Samba read_nttrans_ea_list denial of service
CVE-2013-4124.body: Samba is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an integer overflow in the read_nttrans_ea_list function in nttrans.c. By sending a specially-crafted packet, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to consume CPU and memory resources.Upgrade to the latest version of Samba (3.5.22, 3.6.17, or 4.0.8 or later), available from the Samba Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-4752.title: eZ Publish user/login page URL redirection
CVE-2013-4752.body: eZ Publish could allow a remote attacker to conduct phishing attacks, caused by an error related to user/login page. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the certain parameters in a specially-crafted URL to redirect a victim to arbitrary Web sites.Refer to EZSA-2013-002 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4752.title: eZ Publish BrowserView module cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4752.body: eZ Publish is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the BrowserView module. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the ViewMode parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to EZSA-2013-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4752.title: eZ Publish object relations security bypass
CVE-2013-4752.body: eZ Publish could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error when handling object relations. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to view otherwise restricted objects and gain unauthorized access to the vulnerable application.Refer to EZSA-2013-013 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4752.title: eZ Publish admin design cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4752.body: eZ Publish is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the admin design module. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the root node name and content class names parameters in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to EZSA-2013-011 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4752.title: eZ Publish Request.php URL spoofing
CVE-2013-4752.body: eZ Publish is vulnerable to content spoofing, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Request.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious content into a Web application page, which would appear to be legitimate and could be used to launch various attacks against users of the targeted Web application, including phishing, URL redirection, and cross-site request forgery.Refer to EZSA-2013-014 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4752.title: eZ Publish content treemenu module cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4752.body: eZ Publish is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by content treemenu module. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the object names parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to EZSA-2013-010 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4752.title: eZ Publish error page denial of service
CVE-2013-4752.body: eZ Publish is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error related to error page caching. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by increasing the server load, hard disk usage, and network bandwidth every time a new cache file is generated for each error.Refer to EZSA-2013-009 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4759.title: Magnolia CMS registration.html cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4759.body: Magnolia CMS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the registration.html script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the username, fullname and email parameters in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Magnolia CMS (1.4.7 or later for Magnolia 4.5.x branch), available from the Magnolia Web site. See References. Upgrade to the latest version of Magnolia CMS (2.0.2 or later for Magnolia 5.x branch), available from the Magnolia Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-4784.title: HP Integrated Lights-Out BMC IPMI commands security bypass
CVE-2013-4784.body: HP Integrated Lights-Out could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error in the BMC implementation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using cipher suite 0 to bypass the authentication process and execute arbitrary IPMI commands on the system.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-4795.title: Review Board User Name cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4795.body: Review Board is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the User Name field to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Review Board (1.6.18 or 1.7.12 or later), available from the Review Board Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-4802.title: HP Application Lifecycle Management cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4802.body: HP Application Lifecycle Management is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Quality Center. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to HPSBGN02906 rev.1 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4860.title: Radio Thermostat CT80 And CT50 API authentication bypass
CVE-2013-4860.body: Radio Thermostat CT80 And CT50 could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper verification of access permissions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security and gain unauthorized access to the vulnerable device.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-4867.title: Electronic Arts Karotz python code execution
CVE-2013-4867.body: Electronic Arts Karotz could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an untrusted search path in the autorunwifi python script. If a USB flash drive is plugged into the Karotz unit and Karotz is turned off and on, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-4868.title: Electronic Arts Karotz session token information disclosure
CVE-2013-4868.body: Electronic Arts Karotz could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the passing of the session token authenticating API calls in cleartext. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-4870.title: News Search extension for TYPO3 unspecified SQL injection
CVE-2013-4870.body: News Search extension for TYPO3 is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to an unspecified script, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to TYPO3-EXT-SA-2013-002 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4871.title: TEQneers SEO Enhancements extension for TYPO3 unspecified cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-4871.body: TEQneers SEO Enhancements extension for TYPO3 is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to perform unauthorized actions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Refer to TYPO3-EXT-SA-2013-007 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4879.title: BigTree CMS index.php SQL injection
CVE-2013-4879.body: BigTree CMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the BigTree CMS GIT Repository Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-4880.title: BigTree CMS index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4880.body: BigTree CMS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. CVE-2013-4884.body: McAfee SuperScan is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using UTF-7 encoded XSS payload to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of SuperScan (4.1 or later), available from the McAfee Web site. CVE-2013-4887.body: Xibo is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the displayid parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-4911.body: Siemens SIMATIC WinCC TIA Portal is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. CVE-2013-4912.body: Siemens SIMATIC WinCC TIA Portal could allow a remote attacker to conduct spoofing attacks, caused by the improper validation of input. By persuading a victim to click a malicious link, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to redirect a user to a malicious Web site that would appear to be trusted. This could allow the attacker to launch further attacks against the victim's system.Refer to SSA-064884 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-4944.title: BuddyPress Extended Friendship Request plugin for WordPress admin-ajax.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-4944.body: BuddyPress Extended Friendship Request plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the admin-ajax.php script. CVE-2013-4948.body: MachForm Form Maker 2 is vulnerable to SQL injection. CVE-2013-4957.title: Puppet Enterprise report YAML code execution
CVE-2013-4957.body: Puppet Enterprise could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error when handling report-specific types. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using YAML code to execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Puppet (3.1.0 or later), available from the Puppet Labs Web Site. See References.

CVE-2013-4975.title: Hikvision DS-2CD7153-E IP Camera administrator password privilege escalation
CVE-2013-4975.body: Hikvision DS-2CD7153-E IP Camera could allow a remote attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system. By sending a specially-crafted request to obtain the camera configuration data, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain the administrator password and gain elevated privileges on the system.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-4977.title: Hikvision DS-2CD7153-E IP Camera RTSP Packet Handler buffer overflow
CVE-2013-4977.body: Hikvision DS-2CD7153-E IP Camera is vulnerable to a based buffer overflow, caused by an error in the RTSP Packet Handler. By sending a specially-crafted packet using the Range parameter of the RTSP transaction, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-4988.title: IcoFX ICONDIRENTRY buffer overflow
CVE-2013-4988.body: IcoFX is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking while reading ICONDIRENTRY structure. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .ICO file, a local attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of IcoFX (3.4 or later), available from the IcoFX Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-5009.title: Symantec Endpoint Protection authentication privilege escalation
CVE-2013-5009.body: Symantec Endpoint Protection could allow a remote attacker from within the local network to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by the failure to properly validate user authentication. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to assume another user’s identity and privileges on the console.Refer to SYM14-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5010.title: Symantec Endpoint Protection custom polocies security bypass
CVE-2013-5010.body: Symantec Endpoint Protection could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the improper handling of Application/Device Control (ADC) custom policies. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass policies and gain access to restricted files or directories.Refer to SYM14-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5011.title: Symantec Endpoint Protection search paths privilege escalation
CVE-2013-5011.body: Symantec Endpoint Protection could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by unquoted search paths. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges.Refer to SYM14-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5019.title: Ultra Mini HTTPD resource name buffer overflow
CVE-2013-5019.body: Ultra Mini HTTPD is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP GET request containing a very long resource name, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-5028.title: Kwok Information Server unspecified SQL injection
