CVE-2013-5317.title: RiteCMS index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5317.body: RiteCMS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the mode parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-5318.title: Ginkgo CMS index.php SQL injection
CVE-2013-5318.body: Ginkgo CMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the rang parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-5320.title: MojoPortal EditPost.aspx cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5320.body: MojoPortal is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the EditPost.aspx script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the txtSubject field to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of MojoPortal (2.3.9.8 or later), available from the MojoPortal Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-5351.title: IrfanView GIF buffer overflow
CVE-2013-5351.body: IrfanView is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when processing the LZW code stream within GIF files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted GIF file containing an overly long LZW code stream, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of IrfanView (4.37 or later), available from the IrfanView Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-5351.title: IrfanView LZW file buffer overflow
CVE-2013-5351.body: IrfanView is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when parsing .LZW files. By persuading victim to open a specially-crafted LZW file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of IrfanView Formats PlugIn (4.37 or later), available from the IrfanView Formats PlugIn Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-5352.title: Sharetronix activities_text and comments_text parameters code execution
CVE-2013-5352.body: Sharetronix could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by the improper validation of input by the /services/activities/set module prior to being used in the preg_replace() function call with the "e" modifier in the class_post.php and class_postcomment.php scripts. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using activities_text and comments_text parameters to inject and execute arbitrary PHP code on the system.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-5356.title: Sharetronix AJAX functionality security bypass
CVE-2013-5356.body: Sharetronix could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper validation of access permissions to AJAX functionalities. By sending a specially-crafted request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions to access AJAX functionalities and gain unauthorized access to the vulnerable application.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-5364.title: Secunia CSI Agent data manipulation
CVE-2013-5364.body: Secunia CSI Agent could allow a local attacker to manipulate data, caused by the creation of the /etc/csia_config.xml file with insecure permissions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to manipulate contents within the configuration file.Upgrade to the latest version of CSI Agent (6.0.0.15031, 6.0.1.1012, or 7.0.0.22 or later), available from the Secunia Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-5369.title: IBM Analytical Decision Management code execution
CVE-2013-5369.body: A vulnerability in IBM Analytical Decision Management could allow a remote attacker to deploy a new service into the application. This new service could potentially be accessible by remote attackers and used to execute arbitrary code on the system.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1648929 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5371.title: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager information disclosure
CVE-2013-5371.body: Tivoli Storage Manager for Windows contains a vulnerability during client file restore and retrieve operations to an ReFS file system. The vulnerability could allow a local attacker to read unauthorized restored or retrieved files.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1662608 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5372.title: IBM WebSphere Message Broker and Integration Bus XML4J parser denial of service
CVE-2013-5372.body: The XML4J parser shipped with WebSphere Message Broker and IBM Integration Bus is vulnerable to a denial of service attack. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted XML document to cause the XML parser to run out of memory. This vulnerability only occurs when the security feature to control the processing of a document with a large number of entities that need to be expanded is enabled.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-5373.title: IBM Rational ClearCase client script privilege escalation
CVE-2013-5373.body: A file permissions error with a script installed by default with IBM Rational ClearCase could be exploited by a local user to insert additional commands into the script. These commands would be executed by other users (privileged or unprivileged) that execute the script, leading to privilege escalation.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1648811 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5376.title: IBM Storwize V7000U and IBM SONAS GUI cross-frame scripting
CVE-2013-5376.body: The IBM Storwize V7000 Unified and IBM SONAS Graphical User Interface is vulnerable to cross-frame scripting. This vulnerability can be used by a remote authenticated attacker to access the Storwize V7000 Unified system as an authenticated administrative user with the privilege of the authenticated administrator.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5378.title: IBM WebSphere Portal Connections integration cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5378.body: IBM WebSphere Portal is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input related to the IBM Connections integration. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1655634 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5379.title: IBM WebSphere Portal tagging cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5379.body: IBM WebSphere Portal is vulnerable to cross-site scripting related to "tagging". A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1655635 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5380.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management information disclosure
CVE-2013-5380.body: An unspecified error in IBM Maximo Asset Management could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1651085 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5389.title: IBM iNotes stored cross-site scripting 2
CVE-2013-5389.body: IBM iNotes is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted request to inject malicious script into a page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1653149 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5390.title: IBM WebSphere eXtreme Scale Monitoring Console cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5390.body: IBM WebSphere eXtreme Scale is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input in the Monitoring Console. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1652630 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5391.title: IBM Worklight Android Pseudo Random Number Generator Weakness
CVE-2013-5391.body: A vulnerability exists in the Android operating system where the pseudo random number generator (PRNG) is not properly initialized. As a result of this vulnerability, Worklight programs on Android that use the Java Cryptography Architecture (JCA) for key generation, signing, or random number generation might not receive cryptographically strong values. This issue affects IBM Worklight customer applications on Android that make use of JSONStore local data storage with encryption enabled and have initialized the JSONStore collection using the '{localKeyGen: true}' option. It can also affect IBM Worklight applications on Android if the customer application logic makes use of the JCA functions that are previously described.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1665731 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5394.title: IBM WebSphere eXtreme Scale Monitoring Console URL redirect
CVE-2013-5394.body: A URL redirect vulnerability in the IBM WebSphere eXtreme Scale Monitoring Console could allow a remote attacker to conduct phishing attacks.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1652630 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5402.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management and SmartCloud Control Desk cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5402.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management and SmartCloud Control Desk products are vulnerable to cross-site scripting. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-5404.title: IBM Rational Quality Manager cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5404.body: IBM Rational Quality Manager is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input when using "Search text field functionality". A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1653689 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5405.title: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5405.body: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An authenticated attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1657539 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5406.title: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5406.body: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An authenticated attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1657539 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5409.title: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway SQL injection
CVE-2013-5409.body: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway are vulnerable to SQL Injection. An authenticated remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to various screens, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1657539 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5411.title: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway denial of service
CVE-2013-5411.body: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway are vulnerable to a Denial of Service attack, triggered by malformed XML data. The malformed data causes the XML parser to consume CPU resource for several minutes before the data is eventually rejected.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1657539 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5413.title: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway session hijacking
CVE-2013-5413.body: Logging out of the IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and IBM Sterling File Gateway applications does not invalidate current session values. This could lead to other users employing those identifiers to impersonate that user and perform actions on their behalf.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1657539 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5414.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server post migration privilege escalation
CVE-2013-5414.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server could allow existing users to gain elevated privileges on the system caused by incorrect Administration Security roles being assigned after migration from version 6.1 or later. NOTE: If a migration from WebSphere Application Server Version 6.1 or later has already been performed, all users designated with "adminsecmanager" (Administrative Security Manager) role need to be evaluated to determine if they should have both "admin" role and "adminsecmanager" role. Some users may not need both designations and the privileges should be removed accordingly.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5415.title: IBM Rational ClearCase buffer overflow
CVE-2013-5415.body: IBM Rational ClearCase is vulnerable to a buffer overflow. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1657982 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5417.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server HTTP response cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5417.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of application HTTP response data. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted HTTP request to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5419.title: IBM AIX printer commands buffer overflow
CVE-2013-5419.body: Printer commands mkque and mkquedev are susceptible to buffer overflow by users belonging to the 'printq' group. These commands are owned by 'root' and SUID bit set. The group is set to 'printq'. By default, no users are belong to the 'printq'.Refer to the IBM security advisory for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5420.title: IBM Security Access Manager for Enterprise Single Sign-On information disclosure
CVE-2013-5420.body: A vulnerability in the IBM Security Access Manager for Enterprise Single Sign-On application could allow a remote authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information. Authorized helpdesk users are able to view logs for the application, despite not having access to the URL links. While helpdesk users are able to retrieve information, they are unable to make changes.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1660211 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5421.title: IBM Security Access Manager for Enterprise Single Sign-On cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5421.body: IBM Security Access Manager for Enterprise Single Sign-On is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by a dynamic Web form. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using JavaScript code in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1660210 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5422.title: IBM Rational ClearQuest Web client information disclosure
CVE-2013-5422.body: An unspecified vulnerability in the IBM Rational ClearQuest Web client could allow a remote attacker to see the names of databases that they are not privileged to view. This vulnerability only exists if there are multiple user databases in a ClearQuest dataset. Only the name of the database is vulnerable, not the contents of the databases.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1660036 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5423.title: IBM Flex System Manager user enumeration
CVE-2013-5423.body: IBM Flex System Manager allows an unauthorized attacker to enumerate the list of user accounts. This information could be used to help gain unauthorized access to the FSM.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 5095891 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5424.title: IBM Flex System Manager expired password access
CVE-2013-5424.body: IBM Flex System Manager (FSM) could allow a remote attacker access to the FSM without knowledge of the system-level account (commonly referred to as USERID) when the current password for this account is expired. This vulnerability would allow the attacker to create accounts and run tasks as a rogue user. USERID and the rogue accounts will be running in the FSM restricted shell environment, which blocks the access that an account has to the FSM internal functions. This vulnerability only exists with the system-level account.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin MIGR-5093938 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5425.title: IBM WebSphere Virtual Enterprise Administration Console cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5425.body: IBM WebSphere Virtual Enterprise is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input in the Administration console. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in the victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5426.title: IBM InfoSphere Master Data Management session hijacking
CVE-2013-5426.body: A session fixation vulnerability in IBM InfoSphere Master Data Management - Collaborative Edition might allow an attacker to hijack a valid user's session. An attacker with access to a user's open browser before the user authenticates with the IBM InfoSphere Master Data Management Collaboration Server can gather information that allows the attacker to impersonate that user if the user later authenticates by using the open browser within a certain time. The attacker can view a user's sensitive information. The attacker can also perform any actions available to the impersonated user.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1660082 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5427.title: IBM InfoSphere Master Data Management cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-5427.body: IBM InfoSphere Master Data Management is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to perform unauthorized actions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1663181 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5428.title: IBM WebSphere DataPower XC10 Appliance administrative operations denial of service
CVE-2013-5428.body: IBM WebSphere DataPower XC10 Appliance is vulnerable to a denial of service that can be exploited via certain administrative operations that can be accessed without authentication.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1653546 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5429.title: IBM Tivoli Federated Identity Manager Business Gateway security bypass
CVE-2013-5429.body: The Tivoli Federated Identity Manager Business Gateway 6.2.2 Risk Based Access feature can be configured to require that a user provide a One Time Password (OTP) token before being able to perform a sensitive transaction. As the name implies, these tokens should only be valid for a single use. If a malicious user or system were to obtain such a token and attempt to use it to authenticate after it had already been used, such replay should be denied by TFIMBG. A vulnerability has been discovered that allows OTP tokens to be reused under special conditions. The attack does not require local network access, but it does require authentication and highly specialized knowledge and techniques. An exploit would not impact the confidentiality of information or the availability of the system, but the integrity of data could be compromised.Refer to Security Bulletin 1660510 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5431.title: IBM Tivoli Federated Identity Manager URL redirect
CVE-2013-5431.body: Under certain conditions, Tivoli Federated Identity Manager (TFIM) and Tivoli Federated Identity Manager Business Gateway (TFIMBG) could send a redirect to a URL provided by an external client in an HTTP request without performing sufficient validation of the URL. This could allow an attacker to trick a user into communicating with a malicious site by means of a specially crafted HTTP request.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1654114 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5438.title: IBM Flex System Manager cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5438.body: IBM Flex System Manager (FSM) is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin MIGR-5094212 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5442.title: IBM Knowledge Center Local Edition cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5442.body: Multiple IBM products using IBM Knowledge Center Local Edition to display in-product help documentation are vulnerable to cross-site scripting. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-5443.title: IBM Cognos Express cross-site request forgery
CVE-2013-5443.body: IBM Cognos Express is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1667626 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5444.title: IBM Cognos Express weak security
CVE-2013-5444.body: IBM Cognose Express contains a vulnerability in which encrypted credentials can be remotely retrieved from the IBM Cognos Express server.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1667626 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5445.title: IBM Cognos Express information disclosure
CVE-2013-5445.body: IBM Cognos Express contains a vulnerability in which encryption is unnecessarily weakened due to use of a static key which could assist an attacker with decrypting information they should not have access to.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1667626 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5448.title: IBM QRadar SIEM "Right Click Plugin" cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5448.body: IBM QRadar Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) is vulnerable to cross-site scripting within the "Right Click Plugin" context menus for IP information. This issue is only apparent when the plugin menu is enabled (via ip_context_menu.xml file), and is not enabled by default. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a malicious URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser, once the URL is clicked.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1656875 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2013-5449.title: IBM Eclipse Help System (IEHS) cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5449.body: IBM Eclipse Help System (IEHS), as used in multiple IBM products, is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2013-5453.title: IBM Security AppScan Enterprise temporary files information disclosure
CVE-2013-5453.body: IBM Security AppScan Enterprise could allow a remote authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information. An AppScan Enterprise user could access temporary report files generated by other users provided that they obtain the randomly generated report file name.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1655578 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5454.title: IBM WebSphere Portal URL information disclosure
CVE-2013-5454.body: IBM WebSphere Portal could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a URL manipulation vulnerability. A remote attacker could view arbitrary files and directory contents and obtain sensitive information from the system. The attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1655656 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5455.title: IBM SmartCloud Provisioning and PureApplication System CLI unauthorized privilege escalation
CVE-2013-5455.body: A vulnerability in the IBM SmartCloud Provisioning and PureApplication System command line interface (CLI) could allow a remote authenticated attacker with read only privileges to gain additional privileges on the system. An attacker could use a specific CLI command to start, stop, or delete any virtual system.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-5460.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management information disclosure
CVE-2013-5460.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management could allow an attacker to access communication logs revealed for unrelated records.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-5462.title: IBM Content Navigator clickjacking
CVE-2013-5462.body: The IBM Content Navigator application URL can be opened within a frame in a Web page. In this context it is possible for the containing parent frame to record user input to the contained frame, capturing sensitive information like login credentials. The attack requires that a user be tricked into opening a page provided by an attacker.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-5463.title: IBM QRadar SIEM WinCollect agent dll injection
CVE-2013-5463.body: A vulnerability in IBM QRadar Security Information and Event Manager (SIEM) WinCollect Agent could allow a remote attacker to bypass protections using an injection based attack. An attacker could inject a malicious dll or configuration into the agent, which could affect the security of the host it is installed on.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1656875 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5464.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management security bypass
CVE-2013-5464.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management could allow an attacker to bypass security restrictions for adjusting physical counts on restricted storerooms.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-5465.title: IBM Maximo Asset Management file upload
CVE-2013-5465.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management could allow an attacker to upload files to the server.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-5467.body: Privilege escalation vulnerability in an IBM Tivoli Monitoring (ITM) agent could be exploited by a local user to gain elevated privilege of another user. This vulnerability also affects a shared library shipped with all ITM components and agents.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-5468.title: IBM Algo One unencrypted login request
CVE-2013-5468.body: IBM Algo One contains a vulnerability in that insufficient encryption could allow an attacker that is able to intercept traffic to gain users' credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1666110 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5469.title: Cisco IOS TCP ACK denial of service
CVE-2013-5469.body: Cisco IOS is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper closing of an established TCP connection. By sending a specially-crafted sequence of TCP ACK and FIN packets, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to trigger an ACK storm and consume all available CPU resources.Refer to Cisco Security Notice for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5483.title: Cisco SocialMiner bookmarklet.jsp cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5483.body: Cisco SocialMiner is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the bookmarklet.jsp page. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to Cisco Security Notice for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5488.title: Multiple Cisco products ActiveMQ component denial of service
CVE-2013-5488.body: Multiple Cisco products based on Common Services are vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the integration of the ActiveMQ component. By initiating a three-way handshake and opening several concurrent TCP sessions, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the device to consume all available memory resources and hang.Refer to Cisco Security Notice for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5489.title: Cisco SocialMiner GET request information disclosure
CVE-2013-5489.body: Cisco SocialMiner could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error when being transmitted within a GET request. By capturing the GET request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.Refer to Cisco Security Notice for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5490.title: Cisco Prime Data Center Network Manager XML information disclosure

A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unspecified parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Current customers should contact the vendor for update information. See References.

An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to view arbitrary files on the system.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1666093 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6305.title: IBM Platform Symphony information disclosure
CVE-2013-6305.body: IBM Platform Symphony could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the use of a compromised encryption key. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to decrypt the username and passwords of other accounts and obtain sensitive information.efer to the IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6307.title: IBM QRadar SIEM cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-6307.body: IBM QRadar Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a malicious URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser, once the URL is clicked.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1656875 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2013-6314.title: IBM Enterprise Records cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-6314.body: IBM Enterprise Records is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1662911 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6315.title: IBM Enterprise Records clickjacking
CVE-2013-6315.body: The IBM Enterprise Records application URL can be opened within a frame in a Web page. In this context it is possible for the containing parent frame to record user input to the contained frame, capturing sensitive information like login credentials. The attack requires that a user be tricked into opening a page provided by an attacker.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1662911 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6318.title: IBM Algo One cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-6318.body: IBM Algo One is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1666110 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6319.title: IBM Algo One security bypass
CVE-2013-6319.body: IBM Algo One contains a vulnerability due to insufficient server-side validation, a malicious user may be able to retrieve content on the server that they should not have access to.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1666110 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6320.body: IBM Algo One is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. CVE-2013-6323.body: The Administration Console of IBM WebSphere Application Server and IBM WebSphere Application Server Virtual Edition may be vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user supplied input. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-6325.title: IBM Websphere Application Server denial of service
CVE-2013-6325.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server could be vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper handling of requests by a web services endpoint. By passing a specially-crafted request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to consume available resources.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-6327.body: IBM Sterling Connect:Enterprise HTTP Option could allow a cross-frame scripting attack, caused by improper validation of input within a frame. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to monitor and capture user activity.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1659907 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6328.body: IBM WebSphere Portal is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Web Content Manager (WCM) UI. CVE-2013-6329.title: IBM GSKit SSL/TLS handshake denial of service
CVE-2013-6329.body: Multiple IBM products using IBM Global Security Kit (GSKit) are vulnerable to a denial of service caused by an error in SSL/TLS handshake processing related to session resumption when using SSLv2. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the system to crash.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-6330.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server information disclosure
CVE-2013-6330.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information when the WebSphere Application Server is configured to use static file caching using the simpleFileServlet.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1661323 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6331.title: IBM Algo One SQL inject
CVE-2013-6331.body: IBM Algo One is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1666110 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6333.title: IBM Algo One cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-6333.body: IBM Algo One is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1666110 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. CVE-2013-0499.title: IBM WebSphere DataPower Appliance echo web service cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-0499.body: IBM WebSphere DataPower Appliance is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1637717 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. CVE-2013-0570.title: IBM System Networking switches information disclosure
CVE-2013-0570.body: A potential vulnerability has been identified in the FCoE feature in IBM System Networking switches and legacy Blade Network Technology (BNT) switches running IBM Networking Operating System (NOS) (formerly known as BLADE Operating System). If a switch receives a frame with an unknown destination MAC address, it will flood the frame out on all interfaces on the same VLAN. While this behavior is standard for Ethernet, it is not within spec for Fibre Channel over Ethernet. This vulnerability is not remotely exploitable and requires physical or local access to the network. A successful exploit requires that the attacker be eavesdropping on the broadcast domain (i.e., the VLAN). An exploit should not impact integrity of transmitted data or system availability, but it can compromise the confidentiality of information, although the attacker would not have control over what can be accessed.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin T1019715 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-1885.title: Red Hat Certificate System tus/ or /tus/tus/ cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-1885.body: Red Hat Certificate System is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the specially-crafted /tus/ or /tus/tus/ URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to RHSA-2013:0856-1 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-1933.title: RubyGems karteek-docsplit command execution
CVE-2013-1933.body: RubyGems karteek-docsplit could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by the improper validation of input by text_extractor.rb. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to inject and execute arbitrary commands on the system.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-2024.title: CHICKEN utils module command execution
CVE-2013-2024.body: CHICKEN could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by an error in the utils module. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the qs function to inject and execute arbitrary commands on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of CHICKEN (4.9.0 or later), available from the CHICKEN GIT Repository. See References.

CVE-2013-4030.title: IBM System x systems management processors and other platform management products weak encryption
CVE-2013-4030.body: IBM System X and Flex Systems encryption with symmetric keys shorter than 128 bits is considered more vulnerable to attack than encryption with keys 128 bits or longer. Several SSL/TLS cipher suites include encryption with keys shorter than 128 bits.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 5093631 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-5418.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Administrative console cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-5418.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of input in the Administrative console. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to inject script into a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6341.title: Dokeos index.php SQL injection
CVE-2013-6341.body: Dokeos is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the language parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-6371.title: JSON-C hash function denial of service
CVE-2013-6371.body: JSON-C is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the hash function when parsing strings. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to consume all available CPU resources.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the JSON-C GIT Repository. See References. For IBM products: Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-6391.title: OpenStack Keystone EC2-style tokens security bypass
CVE-2013-6391.body: OpenStack Keystone could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error within the ec2tokens API when generating EC2 credentials. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain access to otherwise restricted trustor's roles.Upgrade to the latest version of OpenStack Keystone (2013.2.1 or later), available from the OpenStack Keystone Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-6395.body: Ganglia Web is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the get_context.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the $user['host_regex'] parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Ganglia (3.5.11 or later), available from the Ganglia Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-6403.title: ownCloud admin page security bypass
CVE-2013-6403.body: ownCloud could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper validation of authentication mechanism by the admin page. By sending a specially-crafted request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and gain unauthorized administrative access to the vulnerable application.Upgrade to the latest version of ownCloud (5.0.13 or later), available from the ownCloud Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-6426.title: OpenStack Heat cloudformation-compatible API ssecurity bypass
CVE-2013-6426.body: OpenStack Heat cloudformation-compatible API could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error within the policy enforcement by calling the CreateStack() or UpdateStack() methods. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to create or update a stack in violation of the default policy.Refer to OSSA 2013-034 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6439.title: Candlepin in Red Hat Subscription Asset Manager unspecified
CVE-2013-6439.body: An unspecified error in Candlepin in Red Hat Subscription Asset Manager related to the use of a weak authentication scheme when the configuration file does not specify a scheme has an unknown impact and remote attack vector.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2013-6462.title: X.Org libXfont BDF buffer overflow
CVE-2013-6462.body: X.Org libXfont is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when parsing malicious files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted BDF file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Refer to X.Org security advisory, January 7, 2014 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6618.title: Juniper Junos port.php command execution
CVE-2013-6618.body: Juniper Junos could allow a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by the failure to restrict access to /jsdm/ajax/port.php. If J-Web is enabled, an attacker could send specially-crafted data to execute arbitrary OS commands on the system with root privileges.Refer to JSA10560 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6691.title: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance WebVPN denial of service
CVE-2013-6691.body: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by missing bound checks on received responses by the WebVPN Common Internet File System (CIFS) access function. By attempting to attain the list of shares from CIFS servers that offer a large number of shares, a remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the device to reload.Refer to Cisco Security Notice for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6707.title: Cisco ASA Software connection manager denial of service
CVE-2013-6707.body: Cisco ASA Software is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a memory leak in the connection manager code when management flows are created. By creating several management session requests, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the device to become unresponsive to management session requests.Refer to Cisco Security Notice for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6708.title: Cisco Cloud Portal access controls information disclosure
CVE-2013-6708.body: Cisco Cloud Portal could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the insufficient enforcement of access controls by the Web interface. By using a browser to download files of the allowed types, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.Current customers should contact the vendor for update information. See References.

CVE-2013-6714.title: IBM Tivoli Storage FlashCopy Manager VMware GUI privilege escalation
CVE-2013-6714.body: In customer environments that utilize Vmware restricted users, users of the Tivoli Storage FlashCopy Manager: FlashCopy Manager for Vmware GUI can back up and restore VMs that they are not authorized to access, enabling them to perform the following actions, regardless of their specific Vmware level of authorization: access all data within the VMs that have been previously backed up and also back up and access data that has not previously been backed up, spawn multiple restores which could exhaust Vmware storage, or overwrite production VM data with backup data.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-6718.title: IBM BladeCenter Advanced Management Module account information disclosure
CVE-2013-6718.body: IBM BladeCenter Advanced Management Module (AMM) could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An interface on the IBM BladeCenter AMM potentially exposes user account names and passwords that have been configured on that AMM. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the system.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin MIGR-5094170 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6719.title: IBM Tealeaf CX Passive Capture Application remote code execution
CVE-2013-6719.body: A non-root level user can substitute the command-line parameter with a string of commands and run different commands. PHP code runs at the non-root user level. This means there are very limited, non-critical operations that can be done. PCA web console access is required to see the vulnerabilities. If login authentication is enabled, someone needs to bypass the authentication to determine what the exploits are. The PCA web console is also not an externally exposed web application. It is primarily an IT management console that is only used by IT, and possibly the IBM Tealeaf Administrator managing their networks.Refer to the IBM Tealeaf Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6720.title: IBM Tealeaf CX Passive Capture Application local file include
CVE-2013-6720.body: A local file include vulnerability IBM Tealeaf CX allows for the ability to download files outside of files that are intended to be downloaded for customer support purposes (for example, log files). Although you are able to change the parameters, you are not able to download any root level files.Refer to the IBM Tealeaf Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6721.title: IBM WebSphere Service Registry and Repository cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-6721.body: IBM WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSRR) Widgets is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1659623 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6723.title: IBM WebSphere Portal WCM navigator information disclosure
CVE-2013-6723.body: A vulnerability in IBM WebSphere Portal could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. In some specific situations, when using Web Content Manager (WCM) navigator components that reference other WCM components and in addition specify the compute="always" option, access control restrictions on individual components are not always enforced correctly. The access control check for the referenced components works not correctly, if the navigator contains more than one entry. Referenced WCM components could be displayed to users, who do not have access to see them.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1660011 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-6725.title: IBM Websphere Application Server cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-6725.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server may be vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of input in the Administrative Console. A remote attacker with Administrative authority could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to inject script into a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. CVE-2013-6727.title: IBM Sametime information disclosure
CVE-2013-6727.body: IBM Sametime could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information. CVE-2013-6728.title: IBM WebSphere Dashboard Framework file access
CVE-2013-6728.body: WebSphere Dashboard Framework contains a vulnerability in a charting feature used to access and delete generated images in a temporary folder. In general this charting feature would be protected by security constraints that limit its use to authenticated users. However, it is possible that customers may misconfigure these security constraints allowing unauthenticated access to the feature. It's also possible that an authenticated yet malicious user could employ the feature to retrieve and delete files.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2013-6741.body: IBM Maximo Asset Management could allow an attacker to obtain information with Birt error stack trace returned to user.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. CVE-2013-6742.title: IBM Sametime Meeting Server information disclosure
CVE-2013-6742.body: Browsers have features that will save password field content entered by users and then automatically complete password entry the next time the field are encountered. The application does not do this and this is fixed by the fix provided here.Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. CVE-2013-6748.title: IBM Lotus Quickr for Domino ActiveX control buffer overflow
CVE-2013-6748.body: A security vulnerability exists in the Lotus Quickr for Domino ActiveX control shipped by Lotus Quickr for Domino. This vulnerability could allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on installations of Lotus Quickr for Domino when the control is invoked as ActiveX by Microsoft Internet Explorer.Refer to IBM Security Bulletin 1662653 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. CVE-2013-6749.body: A security vulnerability exists in the Lotus Quickr for Domino ActiveX control shipped by Lotus Quickr for Domino. See References.

CVE-2013-6810.title: EMC Connectrix Manager Converged Network Edition directory traversal
CVE-2013-6810.body: EMC Connectrix Manager Converged Network Edition could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system, caused by an error in SoftwareFileUploadMoreInfoServlet in inmservlets.war. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) to copy any file to an arbitrary location on the server and leverage this attack to execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges.Refer to ESA-2013-089 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. CVE-2013-7271.title: Linux Kernel x25_recvmsg function information disclosure
CVE-2013-7271.body: Linux Kernel could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the failure to ensure that a certain length value is consistent with the size of an associated data structure by the x25_recvmsg function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a recvmsg, recvfrom or recvmmsg socket call to leak kernel memory bytes.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the Linux Kernel GIT Repository. See References.

CVE-2013-7274.title: Wallpaper Script title parameter cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-7274.body: Wallpaper Script is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the title field to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-7276.title: Recommend to a friend plugin for WordPress raf_form.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-7276.body: Recommend to a friend plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the raf_form.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the current_url parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-7278.title: CMS Afroditi id parameter SQL injection
CVE-2013-7278.body: CMS Afroditi is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the default.asp script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-7279.title: S3 Video plugin for WordPress base parameter cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-7279.body: S3 Video plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the preview_video.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the base parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of S3 Video plugin for WordPress (0.983 or later), available from the WordPress Plugin Directory Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-7281.title: Linux Kernel net/ieee802154/dgram.c information disclosure
CVE-2013-7281.body: Linux Kernel could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the updating of specific length values before ensuring that associated data structures have been initialized by net/ieee802154/dgram.c. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a recvmsg, recvfrom or recvmmsg socket call to leak kernel memory bytes.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the Linux Kernel GIT Repository. See References.

CVE-2013-7296.title: Poppler JBIG2Stream.cc denial of service
CVE-2013-7296.body: Poppler is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by an error in the readSegments() function within the DCTStream.cc file. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted PDF document, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Poppler (0.24.5 or later), available from the Poppler Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-7298.title: Cxxtools HTTP query denial of service
CVE-2013-7298.body: Cxxtools is vulnerable to a denial of service. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP query parameter containing two percent signs in a row, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to enter into an infinite recursive loop.Upgrade to the latest version of Cxxtools (2.2.1 or later), available from the Tntnet Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-7299.body: Cxxtools could allow a remote attacker to hijack a valid user's session. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP request appended with headers from a previous unrelated request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability using HTTP authentication credentials to hijack another user's account and gain the victim's privileges.Upgrade to the latest version of Cxxtools (2.2.1 or later), available from the Tntnet Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-7300.title: Cantata unspecified directory traversal
CVE-2013-7300.body: Cantata could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the unspecified script containing dot dot sequences (/../) to view arbitrary files on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Cantata (1.2.2 or later), available from the Cantata Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-7304.title: Check Point Endpoint Security SSL servers spoofing
CVE-2013-7304.body: Check Point Endpoint Security allow a remote attacker to conduct spoofing attacks, caused by the failure to configure X.509 certificate validation for client devices. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site containing a malicious certificate, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability using man-in-the-middle techniques to spoof the server and obtain sensitive information.Refer to sk97784 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-7316.title: GitLab README.html cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-7316.body: GitLab is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the README.html script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-7319.title: Download Manager plugin for WordPress file[title] cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-7319.body: Download Manager plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the file[title] parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of February 1, 2014.

CVE-2013-7322.title: OATH Toolkit libpam-oath replay
CVE-2013-7322.body: OATH Toolkit could allow a remote authenticated attacker to launch a replay attack, caused by the libpam-oath program ignoring comment lines and processing them as configurative directives. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to conduct a replay attack and gain unauthorized access to the system.Upgrade to the latest version of OATH Toolkit (2.4.1 or later), available from the OATH Toolkit Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-7326.title: Vtiger multiple cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-7326.body: Vtiger is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the multiple scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the return_url parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Vtiger (6.0 or later), available from the Vtiger Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-7329.title: Perl CPAN CGI::Application Module information disclosure
CVE-2013-7329.body: Perl CPAN CGI::Application Module could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the dumping of web query data and sever environment information as an error page. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.Upgrade to the latest version of CPAN CGI::Application Module (4.19 or later), available from the CPAN Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-7351.title: Shaarli index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-7351.body: Shaarli is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the Shaarli GIT repository. See References.

CVE-2013-7371.title: Sencha Labs Connect _method cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-7371.body: Sencha Labs Connect is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by an improper fix related to the improper validation of user-supplied input by a nonexistent page. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the _method parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Connect (2.8.2 or later), available from the Sencha Labs Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-7388.title: Google SketchUp CVE-2013-3664 buffer overflow
CVE-2013-7388.body: Google SketchUp is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when loading BMP RLE8 compressed material. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted SketchUp document (SKP) file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of SketchUp ( 2013 (13.0.3689) or later, available from the Google SketchUp Web site. See References.

CVE-2013-7406.title: MRBS module for Drupal unspecified SQL injection
CVE-2013-7406.body: MRBS module for Drupal is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to an unspecified script, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to SA-CONTRIB-2013-058 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2013-7417.title: IPCop ipinfo.cgi cross-site scripting
CVE-2013-7417.body: IPCop is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the ipinfo.cgi script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of IPCop (2.1.3 or later), available from the IPCop Web site. See References.
